author: AyCarrumba
title: My first Fire Station Playset
review:
This was a gift from a family member for my Sons 4th Birthday. I also chose to buy this for my Nephew's 3rd birthday a few months ago, so I've now built and played with this set twice!

Box/Instructions

The box is vibrant and fun with a good depiction of the built set and its components. The Instructions are great with simple step by step pictorial guides that enable children to build with minimum guidance.

Parts

As with other Junior sets, there are large parts that make up the 'bulk' of the set. The vehicle chassis has proved popular with my son, enabling him to create vehicles with ease - I suspect it might begin to annoy in a year or two when his skills improve but for now it's perfect. The Slide is really nice, such a fun alternative to a firemans pole. Of course there's a Bin fire to put out, and printed screens on the Control room computer.

Minifigures

Two neat little Fire Guys, one with a beard and one with glasses. Did Lego miss a trick not making one a Female Fire Fighter?

The build

Simple and Fun! The control room comes together nicely and I love the arch over the ramps.

The completed model

Such a fun play set with great scenarios to play out. The Fire station is well set up for an emergency, with a bed, the emergency slide, and the fire engine of course.


Overall opinion

Very happy with this set, especially at its slightly discounted price point. It'll build in well to larger fire stations in future. My Son enjoys it hugely and I know my Nephew has as well. Recommended.
